cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River or 115 miles SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later today, then north on Saturday, tracking toward a landfall along the central Louisiana coast and then moving up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City LA eastward to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–65+ mph) likely at the port with a low chance of hurricane-force gusts if Barry strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 3–6 ft above ground level along and just inside the Mississippi River Delta, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, creating dangerous freshwater and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands; possible interruptions to power and inland river traffic due to high water.
